message: group prioritization would also work, I think.
Now that there are more people on here, this is much more important. Hard to suss out what it is that I want to look at, and the giant block of "ZOMG EVERYTHING IS UPDATED" isn't helping me.
yeah i think this is super important for groups like "TV Discussion" where there are shows i really care about, and ones that I really don't want or need to hear anything about
Yes!
Maybe surfacing topics you've commented on with new replies at the top, then followed by new topics, then everything else?
Perhaps the ability to just join specific topics and not whole groups
or that you're just automatically watching every topic in a group you're member of
yeah, a "watch" button for groups you're not member of would be great
+1 for muting

I would advocate being able to join a group (so i can see all the topics, and join more as they come along and interest me), but actually subscribe to the threads themselves - then all alerts / emails / etc. are tailored to your subscriptions.
@rabblerabbler I agree, a mute by default option for larger groups' threads would be most excellent

Same here. Really want to be able to ‘mute’ groups, so that that number in my top bar quits growing exponentially. I only want the absolute most important groups’ topics and messages to inflate that number; otherwise I grow to ignore it instead of paying it any mind.
Or, if you wanted to get clever and possibly opinionated, allow selective muting, but also auto-mute large/fast moving threads. (Sort of what @pewpewarrows is saying?)
+1; I'd be happy with either a blanket join and mute specific topics, or selectively "following" topics.
I like blanket join then mute. Might be more work in some cases but aids discovery within a group.
Day two: I's like to see topic muting as top priority. Things are getting unwieldy!
two features I really want: muting and starring of topics
@judofyr kind of like priority inbox? 1. Starred 2. Everything else 3. Muted?
starred should go above everything else yes, but muted topics can be among the others. I just don't want it to increment the orange unread count

@spencer Agree. Having it mute everything would be much more troublesome because then I'd have to frequently page through all groups to see if there are any new topics of interest. I'd rather be told of them all and then hush the ones I don't care about.
@spencer I agree in that if the emphasis is on discovering new material/discussions, selective muting is superior.
+1 here also
